summary: Christianity is the world's largest religion, with over 2.4 billion followers. It started in the 1st century after Jesus' death and was originally a Jewish sect. Christians believe Jesus is the Son of God, who was predicted in the Hebrew Bible and whose life is described in the New Testament. The religion spread from the Mediterranean area and later became the Roman Empire's official faith. Christianity has many branches, including Catholicism, Protestantism, and Eastern Orthodoxy, each with its own beliefs and practices. Despite some differences, all Christians share the belief in Jesus Christ as the savior.
title: Christianity
